main event: A bright light was observed in the sky over Hamden, Ohio on December 22, 1951, which was reported as possibly astronomical.
interesting points: The light was reported to be circular in shape, 75 to 100 ft in diameter, and was described as white or silvery in color., The source indicated the object was traveling vertically upwards towards Wellston, Ohio., It was too bright to be a star and exhibited a fiery edge., The sighting lasted for about an hour and was reported to be hovering at an altitude of 1,000 ft., The Air Force later concluded it was likely just a constellation star.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
witness description: A civilian who observed the object and reported the sighting.
